Staffbase allows you to deliver own legal documents like Terms of Use and Privacy Policy with your employee app. You can also let employees acknowledge those documents during their registration.

This feature will be activated as part of the onboarding process.
Request to use own legal documents

Start now by adding your own legal texts or link to an existing document on the web.
Choose the legal documents, which should appear as list in the confirmation dialog.

Use placeholders like {privacy} to link to the corresponding document within the confirmation dialog. These placeholder will be replaced by the name of the document and links to its location.

For example, the sentence \With your signup, you accept the {terms} and {privacy}.\" would look like this: \"With your signup, you accept the Terms of service and Privacy policy.\""
These placeholders are available at the moment:
Activate this option in order to oblige your employees to confirm the legal documents upon registration.

When you enable the toggle Resend for Confirmation, a request to confirm the affected legal documents is sent out to users. The first step to send a reconfirmation request is to update the affected legal document and mark it for reconfirmation by all users. You can update several legal documents and mark them for reconfirmation. Only once you enable the toggle to resend the confirmation, the request will be sent out for all previously marked documents.

Enable this option if the changes made to a legal document requires reconfirmation by users. Users will see the reconfirmation dialog and actively need to accept the terms of the updated legal documents again. Users who do not confirm the updated documents will be signed out.

You are about to notify all users actively using the app immediately. All other users will be asked for confirmation the next time they log on. Please note that all users using an app version lower than 3.8 will be logged out.

It is required to add own legal documents in order to regulate the relationship between your company as the publisher of the employee app and your employees. In most cases this includes terms of use and a privacy policy. Please contact our support if you have any questions.

When a user logs into your employee app on a device (mobile or web), a new session is created for him. The user will stay logged in on the device, as long as this session is active.
To increase your employee app's security, you can limit the amount and lifetime of sessions. This is commonly used to reduce the risk of internal data being accessed by third parties in the case of a device loss or theft.

Decide how long user sessions can be inactive before requiring re-authentication. When users are inactive past the set time frame, they will have to sign in again. This will only apply to new user sessions. Set a user session to be a minimum of 5 minutes and a maximum of 6 months.
Set a session lifetime between 5 minutes and 6 months.
Do you really want to close all sessions? All users will need to login to your employee app again. This action cannot be undone.
Limit the maximum amount of parallel sessions. If this limit is exceeded during login, the oldest active session of the user will be closed.
Define length and complexity of valid passwords, your employees are allowed to use to sign into your employee app.
Complexity means the minimum number of different character types like lowercase and uppercase letters, numbers or symbols, needed to form a valid password.
For the minimum password length you can choose between 5 and 160 characters, with 6 characters being the default.
Password length needs to be set between 5 and 160 characters.

The user import allows you to create, modify or even remove multiple users at once. To do so, you will need a list of users in CSV format, like it can be exported from human resource management systems or user databases.

The list needs to contain a unique identifier for each user. This could be some kind of short name, identification number or similar. As the user will be identified by Staffbase using this identifier, it should never change.

New users will be created in your employee app and optionally notified, if an email address is provided in the data set. Users without an email address will be assigned a one-time password / access code, that can be used to complete the signup.
